comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Probably en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carol_II_of_Romania He was Crown Prince from 1914 until 1925 when he renounced his right to the throne in favor of his son, Michael, because of a scandal. However, in a coup in 1930, he took the throne back from his son. Then in 1940 he abdicated in favor of Michael and went into exile. Sounds like a soap opera. www.tkinter.smig.net/Romania/WarEntry/ is from The New York Times Mid-Week Pictorial Vol. IV, No. 1, Thursday September 7, 1916 and includes a picture of Prince Carol that looks to be a match.

comment._content: swanq and artolog: Thanks for the information, and yes, agreed that this is Prince Carol, thanks to the photo in that 1916 publication you located. We will expand this record to reflect his full name.
